WorkItem.Description: The parsing of the filters was done incorrectly by who ever looked over the code that was submitted, and as a result the filters now in the 2.2.18 version of Rawr all all jacked up and almost completely useless. The corrected version is still under evaluation, but did not get reviewed before the release of this version.

Comments.Message: Will be releasing .19 tonight. Can someone please get this worked out?
Please incorporate the filters I have submitted and if need be, I can continue to work on that part as a whole, so this type of error does not happen again, and all user will be happy.
I already sent the fixed version yesturday...  :^)
Why is the OtherRegExEnabled set to true everywhere?
In your patch I mean. It ain't in the current default.
Okay someone else should have an eye on this. I'm going to bed.

The .18 filters have issues because both MTRazeR and I submitted patches.  Both patches were partially applied and likely caused conflicts in doing so.  I am going to download MTRazeR's latest patch to see if I have anything to add to it.  If I have any changes, I will use his patch as a base so as to try to prevent conflicts.

I uploaded patch 3957.  I used MTRazeR's patch 3942 as my base.  If MTRazeR is checking this, please download my patch and take a look.

On a side note, the tier tokens are not properly parsing to the new zone naming schemes <Zone> (10/25).  They still show up as just <Zone> or Heroic <Zone>.  In light of that, I added the Heroic parsing back into MTRazeR's filters with my patch.  I also simplified the Dungeon and Dungeon (Heroic) filters.

I will am downloading your new version and will give it a look over. The problem was not with our stuff, but with the way it was smashed together and then not checked. It is late here, so I will do it first thing in the morning.

I am using data pulled from WOWhead. Every time I try to pull from the Armory, it hangs at the end of the process and no data gets pulled at all. So I am working on getting the data that comes from the Armoury so I can setup the filters to work for both sources, otherwise my filter lean toward the WOWhead data.
This would be much easier if data format included (10N) (10H) (25N) (25H). Anyone talking to them about that?
New patches were applied directly (instead of matching them up in Rawr)
The Filters have been changed, ANYONE WITH PROBLEMS ABOUT THE FILTERS please hold off on new comments/issues until the current Unreleased ones come out (in 2.2.20), which include fixes.
